title: Youth unemployment rate in Italy 2018 , by region
summary: This is a bar chart representing Month in the x axis and Unemployment rate in the y axis.
The Unemployment rate is highest at Month Sicily and lowest at Month Trentino-South Tyrol.
The highest value at Month Sicily is 4.5x times more than the lowest value at Trentino-South Tyrol.
min_summary: This is a bar chart representing Month in the x axis and Unemployment rate in the y axis.
The maximum Unemployment rate 53.6 is found at Month Sicily and the minimum is found at Trentino-South Tyrol where Month is 11.9.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart representing Month in the x axis and Unemployment rate in the y axis.
The Unemployment rate is highest at Month Sicily and lowest at Month Trentino-South Tyrol.
The highest value at Month Sicily is 4.5x times more than the lowest value at Trentino-South Tyrol.
max_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Unemployment rate for 20 number of Months.
The maximum Unemployment rate 53.6 is found at Month Sicily and the minimum is found at Trentino-South Tyrol where Month is 11.9.
The second highest Unemployment rate is appeared to be the Month Campania.
The highest Month Sicily has 41.7 more Unemployment rate than the lowest Month Trentino-South Tyrol.
The Month Sicily has the highest Unemployment rate, followed by Campania, and Calabria. Down to the Month Trentino-South Tyrol which is the lowest.
The Unemployment rate has decreased over the past 20 Months.
Month Sicily, and Campania share the same value 53.6.
The Month Sicily has 1.67 times more Unemployment rate than average.
Summing up the values of all Months, we get total 641.7.
